DataElement.preferredName: Person Positron Emission Tomography Registration Status
DataElement.preferredDefinition: a condition or state at a particular time related to a person's enrollment on a based on a technique for measuring the gamma radiation produced by collisions of electrons and positrons (anti-electrons) within living tissue.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to a person's enrollment on a based on a technique for measuring the gamma radiation produced by collisions of electrons and positrons (anti-electrons) within living tissue.

Property.preferredDefinition: A technique for measuring the gamma radiation produced by collisions of electrons and positrons (anti-electrons) within living tissue. In positron emission tomography (PET), a subject is given a dose of a positron-emitting radionuclide attached to a metabolically active substance (for example, 2-fluoro-2-deoxy-D-glucose (FDG), which is similar to a naturally occurring sugar, glucose, with the addition of a radioactive fluorine atom). When living tissue containing the positron emitter is bombarded by electrons, gamma radiation produced by collisions of electrons and positrons is detected by a scanner, revealing in fine detail the tissue location of the metabolically-active substance administered.:The act of listing or recording officially; officially qualified or enrolled.

Concepts.definition: A technique for measuring the gamma radiation produced by collisions of electrons and positrons (anti-electrons) within living tissue. In positron emission tomography (PET), a subject is given a dose of a positron-emitting radionuclide attached to a metabolically active substance (for example, 2-fluoro-2-deoxy-D-glucose (FDG), which is similar to a naturally occurring sugar, glucose, with the addition of a radioactive fluorine atom). When living tissue containing the positron emitter is bombarded by electrons, gamma radiation produced by collisions of electrons and positrons is detected by a scanner, revealing in fine detail the tissue location of the metabolically-active substance administered.
The act of listing or recording officially; officially qualified or enrolled.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the management of a research protocol and its case report forms.
